content: Former electoral constituency in SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Bukit Ho Swee Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(June 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Bukit Ho Swee Constituency** (SMC) was a constituency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It used to exist from 1968 to 1984. It was carved out from [Delta SMC](/wiki/Delta_Single_Member_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament YearMemberParty**Formation**(/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election)Seah Mui Kok[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)**Constituency abolished (1984)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1960s [General Election 1968](/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****Seah Mui Kok*****Unopposed***[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)17,735[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) ### Elections in 1970s [General Election 1972](/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election): Bukit Ho Swee PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****Seah Mui Kok** **7,862** **68.77** **N/A** [BS](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis)Chin Tian Choo2,20919.32N/A[WP](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))Wee Kia Eng1,36111.91N/A[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)5,65349.45N/ATotal valid votesN/ARejected ballotsN/A[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)11,43293.61N/A[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)12,21231.14[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **hold**[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics))N/A[General Election 1976](/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****Seah Mui Kok** **9,451** **73.50** **4.73** United FrontHwang Ban Cheong3,40726.50N/A[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)6,04447.002.45Total valid votesN/ARejected ballotsN/A[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)12,85893.950.34[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)13,68612.07[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **hold**[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics)) ### Elections in 1980s [General Election 1980](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****Seah Mui Kok*****Unopposed***[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)12,4359.14[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **hold** This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. title: Bukit Ho Swee Constituency
